text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm gonna show
you how to make what I call a bistro
salad it's a fabulous frisée salad with
poached egg on a lovely bacon dressing
let me take you over the ingredients so
we can get started you're gonna need
some fresh frisée lettuce it's been
cleaned and roughly chopped you're gonna
need some thick cup bacon that i've cut
into little pieces
a shallot a little bit of garlic some
parsley a couple of eggs some distilled
white vinegar you're gonna need a couple
slices of bread I'm using some sourdough
some salt pepper and some red wine
vinegar okay so this is gonna come
together really really quickly once you
have everything prepped now the thing to
remember here is that you really want to
do the dressing and poaching the egg at
the same time because you don't want the
dressing to sit for a while and you
don't want you certainly don't want the
poached eggs to sit for a while so let's
get started I have a large pan here with
high sides with about an inch and a half
of water and that's coming up to a
simmer and to that I'm gonna add in some
distilled white vinegar and I'm gonna
let that come up to a gentle boil and in
the same time I'm preheating a little
skillet right back here what about
medium-high heat I want that to get
really really nice and hot stop poaching
eggs can be daunting it can be something
that I know far too well can go so so
wrong and it can be terrible but if done
correctly they can be absolutely
delicious and this salad is just awesome
first time I had it was um in San
Francisco and I loved it I loved the on
top of this piece of sourdough bread
with egg yolk so so good I mean really
really good so let's just get straight
into it I'm gonna put my bacon back here
and then this is thick cut bacon you
want to buy the thickest cut bacon then
you can find so let that go and let by
get nice and
in hot yeah well that's cooking up which
I'll take a couple minutes and we'll
take that it won't take very long we're
gonna do the poaching of the eggs now if
you want to break your eggs into little
individual bowls for this one and two
hundred two eggs now what I'm gonna do
to my boiling water is create what I
like to call a whirlpool affection like
a whirlpool where everything or it's
like really really like you see how I'm
spinning it like that it's all going
around around this allows the egg whites
to wrap around themselves and now go all
over the water good tips now we're gonna
just do that for about 20 seconds or so
and add in my eggs as you can see as its
spinning it'll wrap around itself got
one if that separates a little bit
that's fine don't worry about it I know
that poaching eggs can be a very
daunting task and I am NOT the best at
it and I'm not claiming to be the best
at it this is just a method I find works
for me I'm gonna let these cook for
exactly three and a half minutes for
that set
you know the egg whites will be just set
but the egg yolks will still be running
and that's so important for this recipe
so put a timer on for three and a half
minutes and while that's going I'm going
to continue to work on the bacon my
bacon looks great I'm gonna add in my
shallots my parsley and my garlic and
I'm gonna cook that for another minute
or so I want that raw garlic and shallot
to cook out and then we'll add in our
final couple ingredients and we're done
that's just how I want it to that I'm
gonna add in a little bit of red wine
vinegar or you know as much as you like
really I like my dressing a little on
the tangy side so I put a little bit
more than I should let that cook for

that's the eggs and I need just a couple
seconds longer I have my timer on
they're gonna need 30 more seconds that
can sit fine for 30 seconds when the

dressing you pour it straight over your

starts to kind of wilt the greens but

texture but something magical happens

this is how I will always serve it
because it was just unreal how delicious

oh it's perfection you take your egg

that's how I prefer it but guess what to
